intro: Monimiastrum acutisepalum, commonly known as the sharp-sepal monimiastrum, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are often hairy and have a rough texture. The plant produces small, clustered flowers with five acuminate sepals, giving it its specific epithet. It typically grows in moist, tropical environments and is often found in shaded undergrowth. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
